description: One of Hamburg's most beautiful buildings is the crowning gem of the new Unesco-anointed Kontorhaus District. The brown-brick 1924 Chilehaus is shaped…

description: Thrill to some of Hamburg's best harbour views from this accurately named and quite pretty park.

name: Süllberg Hill

name: Museum für Kunst und Gewerbe
description: The Museum für Kunst und Gewerbe is lots of fun. Its vast collection of sculpture, furniture, fashion, jewellery, posters, porcelain, musical instruments…

name: Davidwache
description: South of the Reeperbahn stands the star of many a German crime film and TV show, the Davidwache. This brick police station, festooned with ornate ceramic…

name: HafenCity InfoCenter
description: You can pick up brochures and check out detailed architectural models and installations that give a sense of the immensity of the project; there's a scale…

name: Krameramtswohnungen
description: In an alley off Krayenkamp 10 are the Krameramtswohnungen, a row of tiny half-timbered houses from the 17th century that, for nearly 200 years, were…

name: Rote Flora
description: One of the most outstanding remnants of the area’s rougher days, the graffiti-covered Rote Flora looks one step away from demolition. Once the famous…

name: Baakenpark

name: Deichstrasse

description: This engaging museum celebrates the classical composers with a significant connection to the city, among them Felix Mendelssohn, Gustav Mahler and Carl…

name: Grossneumarkt
description: Once the hub of Neustadt life, this large, leafy square is pretty quiet these days, although it comes to life with market stalls on Wednesday and Saturday…

name: Sankt Pauli Museum
description: To make historical sense of St Pauli, this museum is an excellent place to start. It takes you back to the earliest days of the neighbourhood, brings to…

description: For alternative, greener take on the whole HafenCity development, this intriguing exhibit takes a look at sustainable urban development and…

name: Beatles-Platz
description: Designed like a vinyl record, it has abstract steel sculptures resembling cookie cutters of the Fab Four (including a hybrid of Ringo Starr and Pete Best).

description: Two grandly restored brick market halls, built in 1911 and 1913 respectively, are home to high-profile special exhibitions of modern art and photography.

name: Tierpark Hagenbeck
description: The 2500 animals that live in Hamburg's zoo have open enclosures over 27 hectares. In addition to elephants, tigers, orang-utans, toucans and other…

name: Altona Museum
description: This moderately interesting collection is devoted to the art and culture of northern Germany since the 18th century. An unusual aspect is the focus on…

name: Hansaplatz Fountain
description: The centerpiece of Hansaplatz square. Completed in 1878, the fountain shows important figures in Hamburg's past, including Emperor Constantine the Great…

name: Panoptikum

name: Cap San Diego

name: Herbertstrasse
description: Along Davidstrasse, a painted tin wall bars views into Herbertstrasse, a block-long bordello that’s off-limits to men under 18 and to women of all ages…

name: Hamburg Dungeon
description: This camped-up chamber of horrors is brought to life by actors, incorporating various thrill rides, and is housed in an old warehouse. It's pricey and not…

name: Alsterarkaden
description: The elegant Renaissance-style arcades of the Alsterarkaden shelter upscale shops and cafes alongside the Alsterfleet canal. This is ground zero for…

name: Galerie Commeter
description: Founded in 1821, privately run Galerie Commeter is Hamburg's oldest gallery, with a reliable offering of contemporary painting, graphics, sculpture and…

name: Wochenmarkt
description: This weekly eco-market (think organic farmers' produce) adds a little life to Friday afternoons in the heart of St Georg. It sometimes shifts to Friday…

name: Star Club Memorial
description: The seminal venue for the Beatles opened in 1962. It has since burnt down and there is a sad historical marker. Thai karaoke now echoes off the walls.

name: Rickmer Rickmers
description: The 1886 three-masted steel windjammer Rickmer Rickmers is now a museum ship; from the restaurant on deck you have fine harbour views.

name: Galerie Herold
description: This small but rewarding private gallery is worth a look if you're in the area. Its focus is on northern German expressionism.

name: Pelikan Apotheke
description: This still-functioning pharmacy has been around since 1656… wander in to admire the splendid period touches.

name: Spicy’s Gewürzmuseum
description: This spice and herb museum invites you to exercise your olfaction to the fullest.

name: Vlet in der Speicherstadt
description: Right by the pedestrian bridge, Vlet has three different menus (plus a children's version) and the recurring theme is the intersection between…

name: Clouds
description: Arguably St Pauli's most prestigious table, Clouds, on the 23rd floor of the Tanzende Türme, is an elegant space with marvellous views out over the city…

name: Laufauf
description: A bastion for northern German and Hamburg cooking, Laufauf is something of a Hamburg institution. The Hamburger Pannfisch (locally fried fish),…

name: Deichgraf
description: In a prime setting, with the water on one side and long streetside tables on the other, Deichgraf excels in Hamburg specialities cooked to a high standard…

name: Café Gnosa
description: With its abstract art and in-house bakery, Café Gnosa draws an affable gay and straight crowd in St Georg. The curved glass windows give it an art deco…

name: Mikkels
description: Even if you miss the morning at this cheery spot which mixes affability with pastel style, you can still sit outside and catch the afternoon sun. Baked…

name: Pauline
description: Tucked away on a residential street and as good for breakfast as for lunch, this classy cafe is enduringly popular with locals, but they can't keep it all…

name: Café Paris

description: Around since 1795 and opposite the entrance to St Michaelis Kirche, this fine old bastion of tradition has long been serving some of Hamburg's best…

description: It doesn't get fresher than this Elbmeile gem. One of Hamburg's top seafood vendors has a simple cafe where top-notch dishes are served to thankful diners…

name: Das Dorf
description: There are lots of reasons to visit this wonderfully traditional restaurant with its wood-panelled dining room. But we love it especially for its homemade…

name: Von Der Motte

name: Ahoi by Steffen Henssler
description: German-born but always with his eye on the horizon, celebrated local chef Steffen Henssler has made a name for himself as a sushi chef. He also does…

name: Eisenstein
description: Altona's best pizza is only part of the story here, in an artfully conceived space where the food is consistently good and the atmosphere clicks along…

name: Otto's Burger
description: Eight different burger types, including one with truffle mayo and two veggie options, washed down by craft beers – need we say more?

name: Fleetschlösschen

name: Kartoffelkeller
description: One of numerous good choices along pretty Deichstrasse, Kartoffelkeller is true to its name and lives for the potato – Kartoffelsalate (potato salad),…

name: Lusitano
description: As unadorned as a piece of salt cod, this little restaurant in Hamburg's old Portuguese neighbourhood captures the bright flavours of the Mediterranean…

name: Tide
description: Part of the growing gourmet reputation of the Ottensen district of Altona, Tide is part cafe (sandwiches, soups, cakes and coffee) and part delicatessen …

name: Fischerhaus
description: Arguably the pick of the sit-down fish restaurants down in the Fischmarkt, Fischerhaus has three different dining spaces – the views are better from the…

name: Casa di Roma
description: One of the better and classier Italian restaurants among many in St Georg, Casa di Roma is cool, contemporary and has well-priced pasta dishes. The other…

name: Se7en Oceans
description: At first glance, Se7en Oceans looks like an extension of the food court atop the Europa Passage shopping complex. Look a little closer and you'll find a…

name: Matsumi
description: Celebrated sushi chef Hideaki Morita creates excellent Japanese fare at this 2nd-floor restaurant where virtually everything is unassuming, except for the…

name: Klippkroog
description: We lost track of the number of times a local told us this was their favourite cafe. Their classic dish of green asparagus, new potatoes and local ham is…

name: Oberhafen Kantine
description: Since 1925, this slightly tilted brick restaurant has served up the most traditional Hamburg fare. Here you can order a 'Hamburger' and you get the real…

name: Kiez Curry
description: All manner of Currywurst (there's even a vegan version) have made this an icon of St Pauli's nights – a Currywurst at 4am after a hard night of partying…

name: Trattoria Da Enzo

name: [m]eatery
description: Tucked away on a quiet street in Neustadt's north, [m]eatery stays true to its name and prepares what many Hamburgers believe to be the best steaks in the…

name: Fischereihafen

name: Thämer’s

name: Markt Koenig
description: Don't be fooled by the location, surrounded by a food hall and next to a supermarket. Markt Koenig is a bright modern place that does a range of local…

name: Erikas Eck
description: This pit-stop institution originally fed hungry workers from the nearby abattoir (today the central meat market) and now serves wallet-friendly but waist…

name: Le Kaschemme
description: The perfect place for a meal while you plan your night out in St Pauli, this clean-lined pub has a good menu of dishes that range from Italian to German…

name: Hamburger Fischerstube

name: Perle Restaurant
description: Down a quiet Altstadt side street in a pretty terrace house, Perle is especially good at lunchtime with a light menu or daily specials. For dinner, their…

name: Café Koppel
description: Set back from busy Lange Reihe, in the gallery Koppel 66, this veggie cafe is a refined oasis (with a summer garden). The menu could be an ad for the…

description: They've been serving quality fish and chips at Daniel Wischer since the 1920s, and it's a terrific place for a quick meal or something more substantial…

description: Vietnamese restaurants are all the rage in Hamburg, and this cool outpost is always popular for its fresh tastes and authentic Vietnamese cooking. Their…

name: Eiscafe Eisliebe
description: Some of the yummiest ice cream you’ll ever taste is scooped from this little hole in the wall (look for the queues). On any given day, you’ll find around…

name: Trific
description: Consistently lauded as one of Hamburg's more creative kitchens, Trific serves up a small, market- and season-driven menu. When we were there, dishes…

name: Cox
description: Behind its opaque glass doors, this upmarket bistro with fluted columns and period decor was part of the original vanguard of St Georg’s gentrification…

name: Nil

name: Carls Brasserie
description: Facing the Elbphilharmonie, this casual place offers predominantly French cuisine, such as croque-monsieur and other toasts in the bistro, with a little…

name: Cafe Gitane
description: We love the tasteful retro furnishings at this appealing cafe and wine bar. The small but carefully chosen menu changes with the seasons, but ranges from…

name: Jools
description: Out in Altona's west, Jools is a terrific cafe-restaurant that does risotto, pasta, Currywurst and even burgers. The tastes are fresh, the service is…

description: This gem of a neighbourhood cafe is the go-to place for warm brioches, some of the yummiest cakes in town, plus daily changing lunch specials. Camp out…

name: Kleine Haie Grosse Fische
description: St Pauli's version of the late-night kebab stop is this timeless place serving fish sandwiches, as well as smoked fish and meats. There's nothing quite…

name: Goot
description: Top regional ingredients are used in fresh lunches served in a casual setting. There are vegetarian soups and salads plus sandwiches featuring roasted…

name: Peaberries
description: Perfect for that much-needed pause, this cute little cafe has excellent coffee drinks as well as tasty baked goods, including the best bagels in town.

name: Strauchs Falco
description: The menu here is astonishingly broad (tapas, pizza, pasta, seafood) without compromising on quality. Their speciality is flame-grilled meats.

name: Konditorei Holger Rönnfeld
description: Sweet offerings abound at this aromatic and traditional bakery. Try a nussecken, a crunchy, nutty, triangular-shaped pastry.

name: Mercado

name: Central
description: We think this place is a touch overpriced for dinner, but the international cooking (which leans predominantly in the direction of Italy) is assured, and…

name: Cafe Sul
description: A perfect place of refuge from the fried-fish-clutching mobs of the port area, this cafe lives up to its name with a cheery disposition, even on a cloudy…

name: Mojo Club
description: This legendary Hamburg jazz club inhabits the fab basement of the Tanzende Türme office towers. Stellar local and international acts take to the stage…

name: Gruenspan

description: Attending a concert here is an essential part of visiting Hamburg's most exciting architectural icon. With a full program, a number of different…

description: The booking policy at this unhurried pocket-size club with plush decor skews towards lo-fi indie-folk-rock and usually features prestardom international…

description: Built in 1908, the Laeiszhalle was Hamburg's premier address for classical concerts and opera. That mantle has passed to the extraordinary new…

description: This plush theatre stages a cornucopia of saucy musical reviews, comedies, soap operas and variety shows. Midnight shows follow the main performance. The…

name: Cascadas
description: One of the better live music venues outside of St Pauli, Cascadas offers up a nightly program that ranges across soul, jazz, Latin, funk, Caribbean and…

name: Zeise Kino
description: This excellent local arthouse cinema skips the mainstream films and shows them in their original version (ie with German subtitles) on Tuesdays. Otherwise…

name: Deutsches Schauspielhaus Theatre
description: Germany’s largest and most important theatre presents imaginative interpretations of the classics (Shakespeare, Goethe, Chekhov et al) alongside new works…

name: Cotton Club
description: It has moved around a lot in its time, but wherever it has been in Hamburg, the city's oldest jazz club has been reliable for live jazz in all its forms,…

name: English Theatre of Hamburg
description: Germany's oldest professional English-language theatre has been around since 1976 and performs quality English drama with English actors to a…

name: Fabrik
description: They're making beautiful music in this former factory that's an iconic Altona venue, where the music ranges from classical to club and the program spans…

name: Kaiserkeller
description: One of the more respectable clubs today on the Grosse Freiheit, this second venue for the Beatles survives in a much-altered form with regular live acts.

name: Knust
description: In addition to excellent live music gigs and experimental DJ sets, this former slaughterhouse hosts anything from acoustic raves to spoken word.

name: St Pauli Theater
description: A dynamic program of high-quality, sometimes-offbeat theatre is the hallmark here. If you speak German, it can be a great night out.

name: Millerntor-Stadion
description: Favourite local football team FC St Pauli plays at home in the multi-use Millerntor stadium.

name: Queen Calavera

name: Zur Ritze
description: The uniqueness of this Reeperbahn classic begins from the moment you pass through the long laneway and between the legs of the large 'receptionist'…

name: Strandperle
description: Hamburg's original beach bar is a must for primo beer, burgers and people-watching. All ages and classes gather, mingle and wriggle their toes in the sand…

name: Zum Silbersack
description: A real St Pauli icon, Zum Silbersack is one of our favourites in the area. It's the sort of place where you'll find students, junkies, executives,…

name: Katze
description: Small and sleek, this 'kitty' (Katze = cat) gets the crowd purring for well-priced cocktails (the best caipirinhas in town) and great music (there's…

name: Le Lion
description: Easily the classiest, most exclusive bar (by virtue of size) you'll find in Hamburg. If there's space and you're nicely dressed, they'll let you into this…

name: Café du Port
description: One of our favourite little perches in St Pauli, this gorgeous cafe does buttery croissants, cakes and other pastries, with fine coffee to nurse as you…

name: Hafenklang
description: A collective of Hamburg industry insiders present established and emerging DJs and bands, as well as clubbing events and parties. Look for the spray…

name: Clouds Bar
description: This elegant bar, above Clouds Restaurant at the eastern entrance to St Pauli, is popular with an upmarket crowd who come here for the highballs (of…

name: Komet Musik Bar
description: Vinyl and only vinyl spins at this treasure of a music bar. Nightly themes range from ska and rocksteady to '60s garage punk and hip hop. Order a Helga,…

name: Indra Club
description: The Beatles' small first venue is open again and has live acts some nights. The interior is vastly different from the 1960s and there is a fine beer…

name: Molotow
description: This legendary indie club still rocks on as hot 'n heavy as ever after moving to new digs when its old location was torn down.

name: a.mora
description: Perched on the jetty overlooking Aussenalster, this suave bar is as good for breakfast or a coffee as it is for a late-night cocktail. It attracts a…

name: Aurel
description: One of our favourite drinking holes in Altona, Aurel is warmly intimate by day, cool and classy by night – in the finest Hamburg tradition, it doesn't…

name: Bar Hamburg
description: A favourite haunt of A-list celebrities (Mick Jagger and Claudia Schiffer have both passed through its doors), Bar Hamburg has more than 70 different…

name: Frau Möller
description: It's 2am Saturday and you can't live without a pork steak? Head to this St Georg institution where outside tables wrap around the corner location and the…

name: Frau Hedis Tanzkaffee
description: On a boat moored permanently at pier 10, this unusual nightclub is also the ultimate party boat. A full program of visiting DJs keeps things interesting,…

name: Kyti Voo
description: A mixed crowd mixes it up with an especially rewarding menu of craft beer and cocktails until very late. At sunnier (or less dark) times, grab a table on…

name: Docks
description: They keep it fairly simple and none-too-challenging at this long-standing Reeperbahn club – house in all its forms, reggae, downtempo and hip-hop dominate…

name: Café Knuth
description: Students, creative types and work colleagues come to chat in its split-level lounge areas. Or grab a picnic table outside and enjoy your drinks in the…

name: Prinzenbar
description: With its cheeky cherubs, stucco flourishes and sparkling chandeliers, this intimate club has luxe looks but is in fact a former cinema that now hosts…

name: Golden Cut Club
description: One of Hamburg's top clubs, Golden Cut has a pretty strict door policy and lines can be long. The stage acts can be wild and some of the best DJs in town…

description: If you could somehow bottle the Altona spirit and turn it into a bar, Reh Bar would come close. Cosy and welcoming, as good for a morning coffee as for a…

name: Familien-Eck
description: It's just a hole in the wall, but this Altona classic is everything a good Hamburg neighbourhood joint should be: friendly, unassuming, yet always ready…

name: Cafe Geyer
description: You could come here for the breakfast, or the reasonable meals. But we love it in spring when the sun is shining and the view of the blossom trees from…

name: Biergarten Speersort
description: There's nothing very complicated about this Bavarian-style beer garden or terrace overlooking one of the few green open spaces in the city centre – the…

name: Nord Coast Coffee Roasters
description: One of Hamburg's growing number of cool and socially conscious coffee roasters, Nord Coast has a lovely Deichstrasse location, donates part of its profits…

name: Bar M & V
description: The drinks menu is like a designer catalogue at this grand old St Georg bar, which has been beautifully restored. Settle into one of the wooden booths,…

name: Gröninger Privatbrauerei
description: Drink in the cellar in one of Hamburg's oldest breweries, where they serve Gröninger Pils from old oak barrels. If you get the munchies, their pork…

name: Wunderbar
description: An extravagant gay bar with luminous red interiors, Wunderbar has been around since the 1990s and shows no signs of slowing down. Up-for-a-good-time DJs…

name: Lunacy
description: As the name would suggest, this is a bar with attitude – the music stays pretty intense with punk, ska, rock and metal, and even the table football is…

name: Moondoo
description: Amidst all the sex shows and sleaze, Reeperbahn does good, old-fashioned nightclubs rather well – Moondoo is a fun, casual place with terrific DJs …

name: Public Coffee Roasters
description: Lovers of fine coffee consider it worth crossing town to enjoy the quiet, casual atmosphere and the selection of excellent coffees straight from the…

name: Nachtasyl
description: A mainstay of the Hamburg night, 'Night Asylum' is all about good DJs and a mixed crowd of locals and tourists up for a good time every night of the week.

name: Uebel und Gefährlich
description: DJ sets, live music and parties rock this soundproof WWII bunker. Doors open around 7pm weekdays but as late as midnight on Friday and Saturday.

name: Generation Bar
description: A popular gay bar right in the middle of the St Georg gay strip. The red light adds to the hazy mood – this is a smokers joint.

name: Tower Bar
description: For a low-key evening with harbour views that will keep you entranced, drop by this 14th-floor lounge at the Hotel Hafen.

name: Gretel & Alfons
description: A late-night cafe and bar that is little changed from when the boys would unwind here after shows.

name: Herr Buhbe
description: Inhabiting one of Hamburg's oldest wine cellars (the wood panelling is magnificent), and the sister bar to upstairs Thämer's, Herr Buhbe is a solid choice…

name: StrandPauli
